name: Colleen
review: I have two of these foundations in the same shade hoping to find some luck, but the foundations to me are different and THEY ARE THE EXACT SAME SHADE AND FOUNDATION!!(shade vanilla) one of them when I set it it has specks of glitters ??? And looks horrible in photos and it says PHOTO Ready. I will say this is buildable coverage and it's very liquidy and thin so if not put on properly it will look streaky. This foundation would be so much better if they changed it!

name: Neshia
review: I use this under the powder and it's pretty good

name: Brennn
review: Would definitely recommend using a moisturizer before applying

name: Jen
review: I love this product! I first discovered it at another place first, I really don't understand these other reviews! The product is great, really smooths out the look of imperfections and large pours! I do mix it with Miliani Full Coverage foundation to get a little bit more coverage, but other than that it stays all day!

name: dani
review: i got it as a cheap product to layer and blend but it's got glitter in it??? said nothing about glitter so i don't recommend unless you want to look like a fairy.

name: Sassy Sue
review: I have been buying this product for over a year now and pray that it will not be discontinued.I absolutely love it.

name: Sammy
review: Absolutely love it! Looked for a dupe for Make Up Forever HD foundation and this is definitely it! My new ride or die.

name: yogirlali
review: This is a great foundation. I just did not like it because it was not full coverage or even medium coverage. If you don't mind it being a light coverage then it's prefect for you.

name: PK
review: It works so I buy it. I am very picky but love the coverage.

name: Mikaylee
review: It was too cakey and thick and was very hard to blend

name: tt
review: it made my face sooo dry after using it for over 2 weeks, then it made me break out. I really will not buy this again.

name: Di
review: This higher priced than other stores I have shopped in but Ulta had the Natural Beige color that I had been looking for.  It is much darker than Revlon Natural Beigh in the Photo Finish product.

name: Jessie
review: I'm cheap when it comes to makeup in general, I also know that buying cheap doesn't always give you the look you want. Especially since I have trouble skin and large pores. For a brand that isn't upwards of 20 to 40 dears a bottle, this liquid foundation does a pretty great job. I use a sponge to apply it, and when I'm lazy, my fingers. It has little "sparkles" or light reflecting particles that make my skin look flawless (as flawless as my skin can look) and it feels lightweight and not heavy at all.

name: Meg
review: There's a ton of sparkes in the makep. Not appropriate for work.

name: Mack
review: I use this product daily. It covets every type of blemish on the skin.

name: Leners0930
review: I don't usually wear any face make-up such as foundation or blush or any of that but with the holiday season coming up and pictures I wanted to make sure my face had some coverage. This foundation isn't bad by any means it's just not what I like. I like lightweight and this is very heavy. However, usually the lightweight stuff comes off and this definitely stays. It does help a lot to even pores and I like that, but it's also caused me to break out a lot which I hate. I would suggest a good moisturizer and primer before applying this, I think those would help. I currently use Rodan+Fields oil free lotion and this stuff works well together, doesn't get oily through the day, but I think a primer would help the foundation go on a little easier.

name: Rosie
review: I was disappointed in with this foundation. I normally use the maybelline fit me foundation. I wanted to try a  different foundation so I thought why not this one its pretty good priced. I do not like it at all it gives off kind of a sparkly finish to it i don't know it was weird. The finish look of it was ok it did have good coverage but it was just really sparkly for me. When I applyed a powder over it the sparklyness kind of went away but as the day went on the whole foundation just wore off.

name: Lisa
review: The best coverage

name: pami_d
review: This foundation was heavy and had an orange tint on my face. I can't say if it was long lasting or not because I washed it off immediately.

name: Michelle
review: Hated this, Used it once and it looked like I sprayed a can of glitter over my face!

name: Rachel
review:
Revlon Photoready Airbrush Effect Review

This is the new and improved formula of the original Photoready makeup. Except that it's not any better than the original, it's much worse. The only makeup I ever used was the original Photoready and I loved it immensely. I had my winter and summer shades all picked out, the formula was not too drying or greasy (and I have extremely oily skin) and the subtle hints of shimmer that could only be seen in the sun was such a unique element to this makeup. I loved it. I bought Photoready over and over again and I was thrilled to have finally found a drugstore makeup that worked for me. I recently ran out of my winter shade (004 nude) and went to buy another bottle but noticed all that was available was Airbrush effect. I decided to try it anyways. As soon as I put it on my skin at home, it turned into a horrible orange color. I didn't know what was going on, I shook the bottle and attempted to use it again but the same thing happened! I double checked the shade on the bottle but it was clearly the same one I always picked up. The "new" formula has changed the color. Once I checked the ingredients, I noticed the sunscreen has switched from titanium dioxide+zinc oxide to octinoxate. I am never buying this product again b/c of the ingredients switch(the previous sunscreens were great for my sensitive skin) and the fact that the color got messed up b/c of this new formula. I hope the original comes back. I am so disappointed in Revlon-You took a great product and made it 90x worse.

name: Linda in NC
review: I have used the "old" Photo Ready Foundation for years, and I never had a rosacea breakout with it. The last bottle I bought said "New and improved" and something about super sunscreen on the bottle. I used it twice and had a MAJOR rosacea breakout in just four hours. OK, I thought, "this couldn't be the makeup I've worn for years, could it?" Well, I gave my skin time to calm down and tried it not once but twice more and EVERY time it was the same thing. I returned it to the store. I don't know what you did Revlon, but whatever it was, you just lost a long-time customer on this foundation.

name: Jack the ripper
review: The product I used to use was replaced by this one. Not a good trade!!!

name: Nicoled
review: I liked this product much better than I expected. I have extremely dry skin and I feel like it goes on smooth and stays on. I would def buy in the future!

name: Color confused much?
review: Okay… So… there was a product before this, I think just the plain photo ready one and that was the one I always got. I went to ultra and this product looked EXACTLY like the other one minus like one word. I didn't know till I got home that it wasn't the one I always buy. So I try to find my color, however it looked a lot darker than normal… I am ivory so I got ivory.. but I got it anyway thinking the colors should still be true. NO. If you are pale like me, this color is not ivory.. it is noticeably darker than their other products ivory so now i'm stuck looking darker because I can't keep buying $14 foundations. It's not a huge deal, I know it's just foundation, but if you got it mistaken for the other product, you're not the only one. Don't get me wrong, I love the foundation, even though it is slightly oily, but the colors can change so beware and watch your packaging.

name: jo
review: Foundation

name: amateur artist
review: If I use this on dry skin I use heavy moisturizers. It is quite thick, but I find that when I mix it moisturizer it does not sheer out the coverage too much. It looks great in photos because of the glitter. This creates a very luminous skin finish, and I suggest using it for special occasions where you will be in a lot of pictures (Prom, wedding, fancy dinner, military balls, etc.) The darker shades are great, if only just a bit ashy for many women.

name: CB
review: This foundation has amazing coverage, but the amount of glitter in this is horrible. When I first put this on I was in love. Covered my acne scars completely but when I saw my reflection in the sunlight I was seriously shocked. WHY is there glitter in a foundation?? And after just a couple hours the foundation started to separate everywhere and looked very cakey. I honestly couldn't wait to get home and wash it off! Only reason it got two stars is for the coverage

name: Mayrioka
review: This product is great, I'm glad I switched to Revlon.

name: LVue
review: I recently purchased this foundation and I must say the coverage was great. However, the amount of glitter in the foundation was ridiculous. I don't see why anyone would want glitter all over their entire face. I quickly returned it and went for the color stay, which I am very pleased with.

name: JRabbit08
review: This is my replacement for Make up forever  ultra HD which is $42 a bottle.  This is the perfect share for my complexion.

name: UPM
review: I noticed the color oxidizes orange so I had to go a shade lighter. When used with a primer and setting powder it lasts all day, even in hot weather. For the price, I was pleasantly surprised. The only thing I don't like is that without a setting powder it can be very shiny.

name: K
review: Medium coverage that is long-lasting for a more made up look. I don't often wear foundation, but when I do, I use this product.

name: Sarah
review: great product not long lasting but does the job

name: HappWhnItRains
review: I use this foundation most days. It's not bad...looks great in photos, but it sweats off pretty easily.

name: Christina
review: Well I like it it just comes off to easily

name: JT
review: Its my everyday thing.

name: MissPicky
review: I've used Revlon foundations for years and years.  My all time favorite is the Whipped Foundation in the jar.  Medium Beige is the PERFECT color choice for me, it's a spot-on match for my skin tone.  So imagine my surprise when I bought the PhotoReady Airbrush Effect foundation in the pump bottle, in Medium Beige of course, and it looked ORANGE on my skin!  Horrified.  I even tried to put my Whipped Foundation over it, trying to disguise the 'off' color, and no dice.  It bled right through in all 'it's shoe-polish looking' glory.  It  was a total waste of money.  Unfortunately, I didn't purchase it from Ulta so there is no return on it, either.  (Lesson learned, Ulta.)  Of course I'm disappointed, I really wanted to love this formula, but I won't be trying any other colors.  I'm scared of it now.  It just amazes me how two Revlon formulas with the exact same color name can be many, many shades different.  This was a HUGE miss for me and I can't even give it away.  I don't know a single woman with "that" colored skin.

name: Adeliepoo
review: Everyday wear makes skin looks nice but too shimmery sometimes in the sun

name: Ashley
review: I decided to give this a shot until my other brand name foundation was delivered. I waited to long to reorder and I was in a pinch. Worst. Decision. Ever. It's super hard to apply, almost like trying to spread crunchy peanut butter on bread (best comparison I can think of). It doesn't blend well with concealer and leaves streaks once on.  Awful decision!!

name: sarahhhh
review: LOVE this product. I have searched and searched for different AFFORDABLE makeup, and this one seems to take the cake. I have had acne for years, and this makeup seems to be the best bet for not over-drying your skin and not feeling super oily. I love it. It makes me feel beautiful every time I wear it. I have very fair skin, so for those who have very fair skin, I recommend this makeup because it isn't too red or too dark (I have had this trouble with Rimmel, CoverGirl, Maybelline and even some BM Products).

name: DB
review: PLEASE DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE OILY SKIN!!!! I have oily skin and when I wear this I have to blot EVERY HOUR!! and it's not just a little blot but full on I look like I just shoved my face in a bucket of olive oil! This makes a normally oily person go from full on pizza face every hour. It is the worst foundation I have ever had! It covers great and looks beautiful on the skin within the first 25 minutes of wearing it but after that you look awful. DO NOT BUY!!

name: Not a pro
review: Great product!  Have used this brand of base make up for 2 years.  Applies easy with an oval sponge applicator.

name: Bree
review: This product had a lot of hype so I was excited to try it. When I first applied it indoors I thought it was great then I went outside into the sunlight and started to sparkle like Edward from twilight.. I returned this product the next day and purchased the l'oreal lumi foundation and loved it.

name: Keithann
review: This blends well with skin tones and cover blemishes great!

name: Disappointed Mum
review: I ran out of foundation and ducked into my local chemist on the way to work. As they did not have the product I usually buy I grabbed this one and I am sorely disappointed. It looked okay for the first 1-2 hours, although you have to apply it with a trowel to get decent coverage. But as the day went on I noticed that instead of smoothing the look of my skin it highlighted every tiny pore and wrinkle, making them much more obvious than without makeup.

name: Stylish senior citizen
review: I found this product to be difficult to apply.  It did not go on smoothly.  I promptly returned it for a full refund.

name: Maddie
review: I was skeptical when I bought it but I heard many great reviews. I love this foundation, but I dislike that there is glitter in it. I'm sure that's only because it is made for photography and the glitter makes your skin shine. Although it's glittery, it's not to the extent that I look like a disco ball. I really love the coverage it has considering the low price.

name: Cee Cee
review: Love this product. I use it on my clients and it stays all day even during the hot months. I did three wedding parties  this summer using this product and had no complaints just compliments.

name: lizzyfran
review: I wouldn't say it's the worst or to stay away, there are just Bette rproducts out there. The shimmer is a little much in this product.

name: 40 and rocking it
review: I have been using this foundation for about 2 years now. There is no cons. I use colorstay for oily skin during summer hot days (love it), colorstay for dry skin during winter (love it) and this one for the rest of the year. Revlon make the best drugstore foundations in my opinion. I could go without the light shimmer, but since my skin is aging I don't mind it. It goes right into the skin but still gives great coverage. I found that lots of other foundations sort of sit on top of skin which I hate. This one (and other Revlon foundations) has really beautiful natural look. I have tried several other drugstore brands that were hard to blend, didn't offer coverage, sank in my pores, had the white dots look (ugh), but this foundation definitely works for me.

name: Donna
review: Loved this foundation, I have been searching for a foundation for normal to dry skin for a while now. I love the coverage and it is long lasting. Not to mention way cheaper than the foundation I was previously using.

name: Shell
review: I have gotten so many compliments since buying this product! I love it so much and it is literally the PERFECT shade for me. It lasts all day too! Can't say enough good things about this foundation!

name: Shai
review: I would love it if it didnt have a glittery tone to it. When I wear it, my face is like a giant sparkle.

name: 212mom
review: It's easy enough to rub on fingers and glide on face.  U can make it as full coverage as you please.  I only gave it 3 star bs compared to high end products u can tell there's a difference, but it's a good value overall.  I also decreased 1 more star bc I have acne and when my pimples start to dry the makeup begins to peel along those edges.  This ofcourse, is hard to control.  I was shiny mid day but I always powder off the shine and I'm good to go.  You cannot use this with a creamy primer such as pore less or others like it.  It mixes well with my oil of Olay serum.

name: 88marcella88
review: I've bought this twice in a row now because it works very well. My skin has imperfections and it covers them well without concealer.

name: Cj
review: I try to use only drugstore foundation and I adore this one. It is cheap, has a good amount of product, and isn't cakey. I sometimes find myself to put a little more on than usual to get full coverage. This is a more medium coverage to me.

name: Purple Lady
review: I've  always  loved Revlon so makeup

name: Litlemoma
review: Great product

name: P
review: I really like this product. However, the naturalness of the foundation is slim. My face always looks so smoothe and very flawless which is so nice but sometimes I want a dewy, more natural finish and that's what I was originally going for before buying the product

name: Disappointed Gal
review: SO streaky, i used a beuty blender, real techniques sponge, multiple types of brushes, silisponge, and even my own hands and nothing has worked for me. A few of my friends have this as well, all have the same complaints. SO orange, and SO STICKY! even smells like glue. It doesnt set, super sticky, not natural at all, and NO coverage.Looks greasy and even when set with powder still very unflattering. exaggerates pores like "no other. When i took pictures in it guess what there was?!?!?! A WHITE CAST!!! in a "PHOTO READY" foundation. overall terrible

name: Makeup lover
review: When I first wore this product it was very shiny and greasy And did not meet standards

name: Shawna the Savvy Shopper
review: This product gives the skin a flawless look, with great coverage. I have small breakouts on my chin that this product smoothes right over. My only issue with this product, is the shade range! I picked up the lightest shade (ivory), and this is still too dark for me! And yes its winter, so this foundation will be much more useful in the spring and summer as i get color, but im not snow white with the skin, so that means there is many more shades that would be even lighter than my complexion that this line doesn't have. Not to mention vise versa, as the shades don't go very dark. But whats new for drugstore foundations! lol.

name: Jay
review: It's sparkles when you set it in on your face and it's very oily, I had to keep patting my face dry due to all the oils in this product! I will never use this again!

name: Pachhhhh
review: This is one of my all time favorite foundations. I have bought this foundation over and over again. There are specks of glitter that will give your skin a sort of sheen and shine to it, however, I feel like that aspect gives it a dewy and natural look. The foundation is full coverage, and lasts all day.

name: hayirwin
review: This foundation is NOT lightweight. It literally is sticky after applying, and has sparkles in it. It is not matte and shows almost every poor and crease in your face. You pretty much have to put pressed powder on to try and deal with the terribleness that is this foundation. Two stars because its heavy, so the coverage is good...but it is sticky to the touch, makes your makeup brushes hard, and is uncomfortable to wear. BOO.

name: Sissy
review: Cgg

name: Yessi
review: I like this product and how light weight it is. I love how it also gives you a bit of a glittery look to your skin. I just simply love this foundation!

name: Mimi
review:
I picked this up as an "in-between" foundation because the shade of the Revlon Colorstay Foundation I typically use what out of stock. This advertises being photo ready, assuming similar to the Makeup Forever HD Foundation, but I would say far from it. The benefit of this foundation is that it is easy to apply and fairly build-able, however; it does streak throughout the day.

I woke in a profession where I have to have a put together on a daily basis and, of course, putting on a face. Well the first couple of days, this was great. It went on easily, worked well, and lasted most of the day. When I was at an event with my husband he asked why I had so much glitter on my face. Oddly enough, looked into the light and my face was covered in little specks of glitter. Honestly, having dark toned skin and then it covered in glitter is not so professional looking. Additionally, it's somewhat greasy and needs to be blotted or a layer of powder over it at least once a day.

Overall, a no go for me on this one.

name: Chi-Chi
review: just wish it wasn't so heavy on my face, also if photo finish was full coverage I wish I knew because I don't need full coverage.

name: SusieQ
review: Good to help cover wrinkles. It is a liquid that is light and easy to apply.  Takes very little to improve your look.

name: Becky
review: Foundation is a good price and just OK with coverage and look.

name: Blondeness128
review: This is a great alternative to department store foundations. It goes on so nicely and has a beautiful finish.

name: CakeBunnie
review:
So I've been really into foundation and I kind of got suckered into the "airbrush" pitch. I was super scared to buy this because of the reviews, but I've never tried to original formula so I can't compare.

This foundation was totally different than what I expected. When I pumped some out, it looked like clay and it just looked like it wouldn't turn out so good, but when I blended it out, it came out pretty nice. It doesn't give a complete "airbrush" look, but it does a good job with coverage. It doesn't last long, like allll day and late evening, but it lasts as long as I'd like it. I don't regret this purchase.

name: sweetshirene
review: I have used this product in the past and liked the quality.  It seems they have changed the formula since I have purchased it in the past and I don't feel it is as good.

name: LaMimis
review: I apply foundation with a beauty blender for best results. Not too matte luv the smooth airbrush perfect finish

name: cristi
review: This mascara used to be my all time favorite! I used it forever.  Until they recently improved their formula. It turns you orange

name: Trendy Momma
review: This is my favorite drugstore foundation! I see some reviewers complaining about the glitter but to me it's just a light shimmer and I really like it. It goes on smoothly and it's full coverage without being too heavy like some other full coverage foundations. I use a finishing powder on top of it and it stays on all day!

name: FreshFaceinSC
review: I have been using PhotoReady foundation since 2009/2010 and have always LOVED it, then Revlon changed the formula... I thought at first it was just a fluke with the particular bottle I purchased. It wasn't. I purchased 3 more bottles trying to color match. I knew EXACTLY which one matched my skin before they "improved" the formula and now all of them have an orange tint and it doesn't match or blend well. I am incredibly disappointed that Revlon would change what WAS a great product. It's frustrating as a customer to try to find something new, because I certainly won't be using the *new* junk. With the old formula, I would brag about this product and I can't tell you how often people would ask me what makeup I used. I would always send them right to Revlon PhotoReady makeup. Even when I worked for the world's #1 cosmetic brand, I wore Revlon foundation. I would get private messages on Facebook of people asking me what I use.. every time, I'd give them the name of your product. Never again. Please FIX Revlon PhotoReady make-up!

name: Megan
review: I tried this foundation on a whim (I'm still searching in vain for that "perfect" foundation) and I was sadly disappointed by this.  As others have stated, this stuff sparkles.  I was putting this foundation on in a natural light, and as soon as I got into any sort of artificial light I looked like someone bedazzled my pores. The formula was not as light as I expected, either- it just cakes onto your face. Overall it was okay, until I woke up the next morning to a small brigade of zits. Thanks, but no thanks, Revlon.

name: Lillie Phoenix
review:
I have used the Revlon colorstay line for like, ever! But this last year I switched to the photofinish line just to shake things up a bit. It has pros and cons. Over all I really do like it. It covers my skin well, and I have hyperpigmented spots from old acne. It blends easy enough for me and I LOVE the pump. I have fair skin and I wear the BUFF color.
I do NOT LIKE the micro glitter in it. I know, I know...its in there to give that illuminated look, but I get enough of that from my highlighters, blushes and bronzers.
I will keep using this make-up, but I do wish they took the micro glitter out.

name: KAO_RX_girl
review: I have used the Revlon Colorstay foundation for about 2 years now. I decided to try the photo ready airbrush effect and was very disappointed. It is much more sheer than the Colorstay and made my face very greasy after only 4 hours of wear. I am also not a big fan of the glitter in this formula. It made my face very reflective, which I did not like. I definitely recommend the Colorstay formula, especially if you have oily/acne prone skin like I do. it really does last all day, with the exception of needing a touch of powder on my t zone midday. I still love Revlon, just not this product!

name: J. D.
review: Heavy. Didn't blend. Glittery. Looked cakey and wouldn't settle in my skin

name: DB
review: I have been a Revlon customer for 15+ years. I think they have quality products and are as good as the ones you pay more for in the high-end department stores.  I have been using the PhotoReady foundation and powder for about 2 years.  I LOVED it.  After learning they had changed this product I contacted Revlon. I was told the colors had also changed.  Based on the color I had been wearing the representative advised me on what color would probably be comparable to that (004 Nude).  I purchased the new formula in that color and was immediately disappointed.  The color seemed dark and it did have an orange look.  I tested the shade below this color but it was too light for me.  And yes, it is glittery.  The texture is different from the old product.  The previous foundation felt creamier and it would glide on and blend in so easy. And it did give my face a airbrushed look. This new formula seems to dry fast and it does not blend well at all.  I now look blotchy because no matter how hard I work with it, it does not blend in. I have used it 3 times and get the same effect every time. They really messed up a good product.  Unfortunately, I will be looking for a different foundation.

name: Crazy for cooking
review: I have very fair skin, so I apply it with a damp sponge for a sheer coverage... Looks great!

name: Divalicious
review: Daily and I constantly get compliments on my skin.

name: Anita
review: At first I loved the lay and coverage on my skin. But HATE HATE HATE the glitter in it.

name: complicated
review: I thought the product had good coverage, lasted during school hours but after needed a touch up. I did not like how it was glittery.

name: DONNA
review: I love this product

name: Savannah
review: I applied it with my beauty blender and the worst part about this product is that it has shimmer to it making it look very unnatural and weird. I have few break outs but this made my face flare up almost immediately!! I would not recommend this product to anyone. I use Revlon products frequently but my favorite is the 24 hour color stay foundation!

name: Laura
review: I've been using this product for a long time. The bottle goes a long way. Easy to apply and looks great inside and on cloudy days. As soon as the sun hits my face people comment on how my face is sparkling.. I hate that! It's like I'm Edward in Twlight.. Not sure why they would put glitter in the foundation. Would be 5 start without it. Also the top of the container will not stay on for anything..

name: Bernier
review: Good daily foundation.

name: alyssa
review: I switched from maybelline fit me foundation to this because I wanted more coverage and something more airbrushed. I swatched this at the drugstore before I bought it and noticed the shimmer but thought nothing of it. Wearing it right now I've been checking it in different lighting and I see the shimmer. I was looking for something more matte. However, it does the job I wanted. I am natural beige I believe and I found it too yellowish if that makes sense. I read reviews and saw that you powder your face or brush off the shimmer after it sets. I will try that and hope it works. Overall its a good foundation for the price. If you're looking for something more airbrushed then diorskin airflash would be more suitable.

name: renee
review: I use this product over 5yrs ..i love it..

name: Lu
review: It looked like , I put glitter on my face. Did not liked.

name: Scoobs
review: I got this at the store wanting to try something with a heavier coverage. I have been using Ready Set Gorgeous the past few months but it doesn't last all day for me. This airbrush stuff is great! I hear a lot about the "sparkle" but it really isn't noticable. I always use a bit of powder to set my foundation though so that may help. It's medium to heavy coverage--I have some acne scarring and it really covers those areas nicely. Feels a bit heavy and tight but I can live with that. I have oily/dry combination skin and though I am usually a nude beige I got the lighter plain "nude" color and that worked really well with my skin tone. So go lighter than usual is my reccomendation and use powder after putting it on.

name: Jamie
review: This foundation is alright, not my favorite. When I apply it I notice little specks of shimmer or glitter which I didn't know when I purchased it. I would rather have a matte foundation and apply a highlighter where I want it. But other than that it's an average foundation that does its job.

name: Dee
review:
I love this foundation! I find applying it with a sponge helps to make application easy and quick. I apply powder after I apply this foundation when I don't want my face sparkling. I've noticed foundations with SPF make the foundation finish not as matte looking but if I apply powder afterwards it's perfectly matte and it is long wearing until I wash it off at night.
My makeup looks great in photos/selfies too like the name implies..."Photo Ready".

name: Justbeth
review: Not as good as I thought it would be. Cover girl or other cheaper brands work just as good. I thought this would have better coverage and smoothe out my skin better.

name: amandaRw
review: Love this foundation!  It is a little pricey,but it really does last all day. This is my new everyday foundation!

name: do not shine bright like a diamond
review: I really wanted to love this. I prayed it would work. As i applied it I noticed all these sparkles on the back of my hand where I pumped the foundation. Thinking it was a fluke I put more light towards my face. The sparkles were everywhere. I looked like well Twilight exploded on my face. So i said ok this is a no go as I was getting ready to go out. I went and washed my face really well with a scrubbing face cleanser. Came and sat back down and there are still sparkles. Woke up the next morning with about 6 new breakouts. Its going back this weekend.

name: Gma
review: The product has good coverage and is easy to use.  I use a light powder after applying the make-up.

name: Gabby
review: i bought this foundation because i heard that it was a great foundation but when i got home i tried it on and realized there was glitter in it and when i was inside it was somewhat ok but when i went outside i looked like a freaking cullen! although the foundation was pretty  high coverage for me it also made my skin very orange and cakey with even the slightest amount put on

name: misslady
review: I love this foundation! Well, I did. I wore it in the lightest color (ivory) and it matched me perfectly. Went to buy a new bottle and saw they changed the formula. Got the same color and compared it to my old bottle, only to find the color is completely different now. I'm so disappointed.

name: Peggyster
review: It is a wonderful product, however I have an oily face, Ihave to use rice poweder on top, but it spoils the glow effect on the face. I wish they make the same product however for the T-oily face individuals!! Otherwise it is wonderful

name: Lovely
review: I noticed that a sponge or wedge works best to apply. I have dark circles around the eyes and multiple tones in my face. This gives an even coverage with very little product. Half pump to one full pump lasts me all day regardless of how much I apply

name: Lana
review: I love this make up it stays all day with my primer.

name: Karen
review: Daily makeup that covers well without looking heavy.

name: lalis
review: I loved this make up it WAS my go to for special events. When I recently purchased this again I noticed it said "NEW FORMULA" I figured it would be even better... I picked out my usual shade. When applying I noticed it gave me an orange shade completely different from the shade I chose.  Very disappointed... can you bring back the original formula??? Has it been discontinued??

name: P
review: Can not apply a heavy coverage

name: abrooke8
review: After the reformulation I  no longer wear the same shade. I had to return the product because it was too dark. It still seems to perform great but it was an inconvenience to return the product.

name: JS
review: I prefer a more natural luminous look. This left almost a sparkle or shimmery look.

name: houstongirl
review: This is a great dupe for the Makeup Forever HD foundation. It has a smooth satin finish and blends well with a beauty blender or brush. It hasn't caused me breakouts and with a primer and setting powder, stays on all day.

name: Lisa
review: Great Product. Works as well as High end Department Store Products.

name: unsatisfied customer
review: While I was on the hunt for the new maybelline fit me matte + poreless foundation,  I came across this one.  I asked the lady who was in charge of the makeup section if this foundation would suit someone with my skin type and she said yes. Unfortunately,  when I tried this.... It was like I had mixed glitter with my foundation. I practically looked like a disco ball... and that's no exaggeration. In my opinion,  if you're oily this isn't for you, but if you like that glittery face look then by all means give it a try.

name: marissa
review: love it..it's a medium to full coverage foundation which I love

name: Elela
review: I intended to buy Clinique foundation/concealer, but my Ulta doesn't carry it in store, and without having a good idea of what color, I didn't want to buy online. So I substituted for the time being with Revlons Photoready Airbrush foundation. I've used revlon foundations many times, but I've never bought the "photo ready." Typically that means shimmer- which this product has. I was a bit hesitant to use it on a daily basis bc of that, but for lack of having any other foundation at the time, I tried it. It has decent coverage- a bit thinner than I would prefer, but it builds well. The shimmer isn't extremely noticeable, but it does give you a nice "glow." I have the 003 Shell, and in store it seemed like the right shade, but it seems to become a bit too orangey by the end of the day. Not terrible, and decent for the price.

name: Marissa
review: The product was fine, but I didn't like the smell. I usually like a bit more coverage, and nicer quality for the price I paid.

name: Kristen
review: Left my face feeling very sticky

name: Disappointed Customer
review:
I bought this product on New Year's Eve after swatching it on the back of my hand in Ulta. At first impression, the gel-ish texture felt good on my skin, had great pigmentation, and had a pump (which is the reason I'd stopped using my previous foundation). I applied it that night to go out and thought it was perfect. My skin looked airbrushed and felt fantastic all night, and it was easy to apply.

However, it didn't stay perfect for long. Cleaning this foundation out of my Beauty Blender was a pain, and I felt like I couldn't use my sponge without immediately doing a full cleaning between uses because of the texture left on it.

Soon, the application went bad. A few days after first using it, I applied a full face of make-up and walked out of the house to see my face covered in so much glitter that I could have been mistaken for the cast of Twilight! At the time, I assumed that the glitter wasn't from the foundation and was the result of my carelessness. It drove me so crazy that I removed it with Vaseline in the car. A few days later, when I had my magnification mirror, I saw that the culprit for the glitter was this foundation. Then came the worst day of all. During the recent cold spell, I applied my foundation normally and saw that it was refusing to go into my skin. It was just sitting there and causing this awful texture. I removed it all and opted for a BB cream.

I honestly feel like I can't give the foundation a 1 star because the first night was so good with it! Maybe I let it get cold or just need to use it at night. But I have to admit that this is the full coverage foundation that pushed me back to BB creams and just concealer. Will I use this foundation regularly or even buy it again? No.

name: Christina
review: I use this product daily. I have to say it has its hit and misses at times. If I wear it all day and move around there are days where it ends up leaving my dark spot areas more visible, however I do touch my face here and there through the the day. I love that if I apply this once let it dry and apply once more in the dark spot areas you would not know I had any. I was cleaning last Friday and I sweated Plenty and the make up still held up really well.

name: Christie
review: Love this product!

name: Elle
review:
I love my high end products, but I wanted a foundation I wouldn't feel guilty for wearing only for a few hours, so I tried this one.

What a mistake.

I'm in high school. This foundation made me look due to retire. It clings to dry patches, EXTREMELY emphasizes pores and looks so cakey. Plus it has random glitter, not good for sensitive skin.

Overall, I really really really dislike it. Try L'Oreal Lumi or Pro Matte instead!!

name: Ryn
review: This product is ok. I ran out of my makeup forever HD and all the stores around me that carried it were out. So I figured I'd try this. It doesn't stay on for more than 6 hours usually. And none of the colors are exactly my skin tone, I'd have to mix for that. It covers well. But I'd rather buy makeup forever.

name: Jojo
review: Love the photoshot primer and foundation medium beige

name: Lilybunny
review: U love this product and you can add on with out it felling cakie.

name: Ashley
review: This foundation would be amaze-balls if it weren't for all the sparkles!  They are not subtle either!  Whyyyyy???!!!

name: Jess
review: Really disappointed. I've used this product for years and they recently made this new & improved version which was a downgrade from the original product. I'm going to switch to something else.

name: Andrea
review: I have used the old formula for years, and I loved it. I used to get many compliments on my makeup. It covered great and felt light. It also worked fine with all different powders. Now I had to buy the new formula, and it barely glides over my face. It feels almost like I'm applying a face mask. My normal color is Natural Beige, with the new formula, I look orange. It does not blend well into your jaw line either. They really messed up a good thing. I will have to search for a new foundation now.

name: SaintAlia
review:
The fact is, the Revlon Photoready line for the face is probably the best you're going to find for the price. Granted, I haven't tried Nyx yet, but I've used Covergirl and l'Oreal and this one blows them away. This foundation never get orangey, provides great coverage, and lasts all day (sometimes two, haha). It blends so naturally with my skin tone, too, there's no line from face to neck whatsoever. It's been a while since I tried something new, maybe other brands have stepped up their game, but this stuff works. I have to buy it in Ivory, everything else is too dark for me, even Vanilla, but they have a good range of colors for all type.

NOTE: Pairing with the Photoready powder to set you makeup can look a little pancake-y according to my mother. I think I look fine, but these days I'll pair it with the Nearly Naked powder for my every day face, and the Photoready for going out.

name: Becky
review: Like many other reviewers, I've used this foundation for years without ever considering anything else - it was perfect! I ran out and purchased another bottle only to be stunned when I put it on. I then realized that they changed their formula. The new foundation was sticky and the color was way off - way too dark and yellowish/orange to be considered ivory. Unfortunately, I'm not longer a wearer of this product due to the change. Very sad, Revlon.

name: N
review: I don't even know were to begin with this foundation. I have mixed feelings. I got this foundation at Ulta because I was running out of the foundation I was previously using and I wanted to try something new. I heard by mouth this foundation was good and that it gave you an airbrush look. I also heard it was a dupe for the Makeup HD foundation...I bought this foundation and tried it the next day and I am not really a fan. I wish I would have read the reviews first before buying. This foundation was hard for me to apply. I felt like I was dragging the foundation on my face. It feels lightweight and stays put all day (for me). This foundation also has sparkles in it and I am not a fan. I got into my car and looked at myself in the mirror and there was a lot of glitter on my face. I started mixing this foundation with other foundations so I can minimize the glitter and to make the application of the foundation smoother and it's been working...Overall, I think any1 thinking about this foundation should read the reviews. I think it's a pass and I will not be repurchasing!

name: Rhonda
review: Product is great for full coverage that lasts.  Love the way it makes my skin look!

name: ashley.vivian
review: I've bought Revlon Photoready Ivory for years. It's been my go to foundation, but now I'm going to have to hunt for something else if they don't lighten this one back to the original tone. It appears orangey-yellowish on my skin and overly greasy. I'm using twice the setting powder I normally have to use just to keep it from transferring. Please Revlon, go back to the original formula.

name: PJ
review: I was pleased with this product. I usually pay  much more for foundations.

name: Mary
review: The color was great for my skin but the foundation had A LOT  of glitter and sparkle in it. I usually like a more matte finish but I wanted to try something more light on my skin but it seemed very blotchy and came of very easily.

name: Sabz
review: The airbrush effect comes from the tiny glitter that's in the foundation. It is very noticeable in daylight and not flattering at all. I will finish using my bottle but will not purchase it again.

name: momma  mia
review: Really great coverage for all day

name: The grease-free second dayer
review: It got rid of my redness but did nothing to cover my zits, and for how much it costs I was expecting something a lititle better.

name: Magpie
review: I bought this foundation after making a trip to ULTA and discovering that the foundation I LOVE was discontinued. After pacing the ailes looking at foundation I picked this one. Very dissapointing. I was really bummed to find that it was difficult to find what to apply it with. My beauty blender and all my foundation brushes just seemed to push the product around in weird patches. I found my fingers were the best option which meant it was more time consuming. Instead of blending I found it really just sat on top of my skin like a mask no matter how much or little I used. To finish off this let down it stayed on my face for, at most, 3 hours even when I used setting spray. Needless to say I will not be buying this again.

name: CarmelGoddess
review:
So I have been obsessed with trying to find a foundation that gives my face a kinda flawless air brushed look!! and this did it for me!! :) For the most part i have Normal skin with a little oily T zone But thats easily fixed with primer. I used my Real Techniques Stippling Brush and it went o very smoothly. I am in the shade Cappuccino. It doesnt feel greasy or heavy.

I think that women arent doing their research properly when they buy foundation. This isnt for oily or acne prone skin! it can build to a medium coverage which is fine for me cuz i have nice looking skin. Yes if you use too much it can look cakey.I used about a pump and a halp for my face and it loos gorgeous. If this is breaking you out it might be something in the formula. Like i said ladies do your research before hand!

Also yes it is sparkly, but personally i enjoy it :) makes my face look radiant. I will buy this again!. This works better than my 3 high end foundations! I have only had it on so i cant say how long it last But its been about 2 hours and im not oily yet so thats good :)

name: Jessica E
review: I tried this because apparently it's supposed to be a Dupe for Mac and MUFE. It definitely doesn't have the airbrush effect as it states.. I had to use 2 coats and it still didn't cover as well as my other foundations. It also feels very watery and wet compared to other liquids I've used. It didn't stay on all day either, I had to touch up mid day. But for ligh to medium coverage or someone who doesn't use or need much foundation, I'd say it works well.

name: A
review: Bought this product after using the Revlon Colorstay, because the packaging looked much better. It's very easy to pump out and very easy to apply to the skin. It's super blenable and made my skin look flawless. I have dry skin and I must say this is the best foundation I've used on my skin. It usually lasts all day with my Rimmel primer. Covers up redness very well. :-)

name: shan
review: love this product it matches really well.

name: rabrewster
review: I bought this scaling down my budget, so initially I wasn't thrilled to buy it, but it is THE BEST foundation I've ever used, period.

name: Talia
review: I have the shade Vanilla, though I probably need Ivory. Ivory just looked darker in-store, so I went with Vanilla. This foundation is very shimmery and likes to move around your face. It feels greasy and moist all day, and just looks like you dumped fine glitter all over your face. I don't like it and it is honestly kind of a waste of money.

name: Kitten
review: Absolutely love this product, works great. Be careful to how much you apply cause it will get cakey fast. Only a small dab will do.

name: JanetD
review: I really, really wanted to love this makeup! I am trying to find something to use for my wedding. Makeup Forever and Smashbox HD foundations are just out of my budget. I looked online and this makeup was the supposed "dupe". I bought this really hoping it would work. I was really disappointed. My #1 problem was that there was very little coverage and the makeup is very thin and watery. I tried putting on layer two to see if I could get better coverage. However my fiance came home and wanted to know why I looked like a disco ball... I guess in certain lights, the make up looks very glittery and shimmery like the vampires, from that franchise.  Needless to say I returned it.

name: Jean
review: Not worth 1 star ⭐️ . Have 1 because I had to give one.

name: Ulta lover!
review: Would buy again !

name: Marcela
review: I use it daily, I love that it has SPF 20 !!

name: Melibell
review: I have no complaints, this product is super easy to use. I can apply it with a beauty blender, a brush or even my fingers and it glides nicely

name: CGM
review: This foundation applies and spreads easily.  Long lasting, light coverage perfect for summer.

name: Lisa
review: There is no other like this!!!!

name: Jade
review: This is a great product. I was using Clinique foundation before but in the Texas heat it doesn't last. I switched to this foundation because I have melisma and it is hard to cover up. This foundation worked perfectly.

name: idk
review: it's a good foundation but i i hate how it has sparkles in it

name: Kim the Powerlifter
review: I have always used Clinique but it can be a little pricey. My daughter tried this product and fell in love with it. She always used higher priced foundations because the cheaper brands never gave her the coverage she wanted and she is prone to breakouts. So glad my daughter shared this product with me. Love it!

name: E
review: This has saved me from buying $30 foundations with how great of a job it does. I use this for everyday coverage and I can also use it for a night out. This can stay on for a whole day if you use a setting spray with it.

name: Lina P
review: Loved it very much. Blends perfectly with my skin tone and looks very natural.

name: Beach'n
review: Color was not matched well to me. Coverage was pretty good. Was not my favorite. Gave it to my mom.

name: Suzy Q
review: I've been using Revlon Photoready Airbrush Mousse makeup. When Ulta had its Buy 2 Get 1 Free Revlon special, I decided to restock. Couldn't find any Mousse, so I bought this. It. Is. Awful. I felt as if I were applying a clay or mud mask. The texture is awful. And the color was so orange-y and very unlike the Mousse, which I loved and on which I received so many compliments about my complexion. I even tried applying the Revlon Photoready Primer first, but it didn't make a bit of difference. I do not recommend this product.

name: diane646
review: primer or moisturizer did not even help this product

name: Ashley
review:
Initially I liked this foundation but I found it oxidizes way too orange for me, so despite looking okay when I first put it on, after about ten minutes it dries down to a shade that is not my color at all. So embarrassing to have my face be such a different color from my neck! Not only that, but it's extremely cakey and enhances all my pores. I've never had much trouble with foundation since I have fairly smooth skin texture and small pores, but this transformed me into something else. I even tried mixing it with other products to salvage the purchase -- bb cream, facial oil, another foundation -- and nothing helped. Even setting it was a lost cause. I will give that it has insane staying power but when it doesn't look good, is it really worth it?

You're better off purchasing other drugstore brand foundations over this one. Very sad it didn't work for me, but I guess there's a first for everything.

name: Ellie Ganja
review: I bought this foundation along with the ULTA Double Duty Wet & Dry Pressed Powder. I was very impressed with the powder but disappointed of this foundation. It is very glittery, light coverage, and almost looks see-through. Unfortunately, not a good product.

name: nelly
review: If you are looking for a matte foundation this is not the one for you. I bought it and didn't realize it until I got home. It has a lot a lot of glitter. I suggest going on YouTube and searching the productivity buying.

name: Shon
review: Great deal and good product

name: Beauty Buyer
review: I love this foundation. It bells so easily and gives such a natural finish. You can build up without the foundation looking cakey. Smells okay. Overall, reccomed!

name: Ellie e
review:
I have extremely dry skin with a lot of redness. I find that this foundations apples beautifully to my dry skin after I have moisturized leaving me with a fresh dewy finish and a lightweight feel. However this only happens when applied with a damp beauty blender. When I apply with a brush or fingers it feels quite heavy and appears cakey.
It covers my redness and evens out my complexion perfectly however I can still slightly see my freckles pop through if I look closely enough so I would say a light/medium coverage (with only one thin layer applied with beauty blender). This foundation is buildable and can reach a good medium coverage.
I don't find that this foundation has particularly great staying power but that is probably because I do not wear a primer or any powder.
One thing I am not totally fond of is the teeny tiny glitters in the formula. However they are not glaringly obvious and they do enhance that glow.
Despite the spf I do not get any flashback in photography.

name: make up
review: nice and smooth

name: Diana
review: Overall good when on sell

name: Parrisgirl
review: Love it.

name: Tamika B.
review: Love this foundation, it my fav so far! I've used it for three years and no breakouts! Gives me a flawless finish and does not clog my pores.

name: Sharon
review: I have fairly dry skin. I normally use a daily moisturizer under my "normal/dry"-skin-formulated foundation. I love the Revlon Colorstay, but THIS is SO greasy/oily. Even with blotting and setting powder, this was a slippery mess. (I use a good brush for application and do not use much product at one time - I build up to desired coverage.)

name: SLG
review: I heard this was a top rated product so that was why I purchased it, but it didn't work well for me. The coverage wasn't all that great and it felt a little cakey on my skin with little coverage. I used a beauty blender to blend the product out.

name: Katty
review: Was not a photo finish coverage

name: VIctoria Pacheco
review: I TRIED BETTER FOUNDATION FOR AROUND THE SAME PRICE. DOESNT LAST LONG!

name: Katrina
review: This product doesn't blend well. It's thick, oily, and feels heavy.

name: Carolena
review: I have used PhotoReady for many years.  I recently had a professional makeup for our 40th wedding anniversary Renewal of Vows.  This person told me I should use a lighter shade, so I tried it last week and it covers just as well and makes me look fresher and younger!

name: Flawless
review:
This product was recommended to me. Unfortunately, it does not perform as it states on the bottle. So disappointed.

Going back to my Revlon Colorstay 24 hour coverage for combination oily skin. That stuff stays all day with a great finish... And it costs less. Same company. Go figure.

name: Hope
review: I found that this Foundation was good except for the fact that there were literal tiny specks of glitter in it? I wasn't sure if it was just mine or not so I Googled it and many other girls said the same thing. Despite the fact that it had glitter, it looked nice when using flash photography but I wouldn't wear this out because I will end up looking like Edward from twilight when he steps into the sun! And I do not have oily skin at all so it was glitter ,not my skin.

name: Brittany
review: I loved how it covers up everything, I just wish it had a matte finish! But awesome for the price!

name: Christen5477
review: Always loved this foundation compared to the pricey ones on the shelf.  It covers great and I have been using it for years! Great for my oily skin!

name: Lex
review: I love this product! I got the 001 Ivory, and at first it seemed a little too tan, but blends very well and has a great natural look that covers any redness or freckles!

name: No
review: It's too oily

name: BrittFlo21
review: Very disappointed I was expecting a full coverage matte formula however this formula was thin and watery as if its been melted. I had to use twice my normal amount to attain a full coverage I was happy about. Definitely not worth the price.

name: Sarah
review: Didn't like it

name: shelby
review: to lightweight / does not stay on very long

name: pnygrl007
review: I use this everyday, and it lasts all day. No touch up required.

name: Dieti
review: I use this only when I want more coverage. I usually only use a light tinted facial sunscreen. I tend to hate foundation so I was looking for something with a light feel. I saw a few reviewers mention sparkle or glitter. I purchased the lightest shade and it is a soft matte, so not sure what shade they have or if they are reviewing  the correct product. This stuff even covered a small patch of pregnancy mask that stayed behind.

name: Cindy
review: I use this product daily. I have Tarte which I love, but too pricey for everyday wear. If there comes a time I can't afford Tarte this will be my go to make-up

name: Miss L.
review: I loved the original formula. It was great for normal skin, medium coverage, easy to apply, blend, and the shimmer was very subtle. The new formula has not only insane amount of shimmer but also little pieces of glitter in it. I was shocked when I first used it. Great foundation ruined by this. It went right back to the store because it's simply not wearable. I wish REVLON listened to customers.

name: Mari
review: Love this product always use it!

name: Special K
review: Nice, high-quality foundation. Blends well and leaves a matte finish. I'm pretty fair, with freckles, and it can be hard to match my skin, because while it's pale, it's also got yellow undertones. This blends well for me.

name: Dudette
review: I have used both "budget" brands as well as brand names and I REALLY like this foundation.  This is the first time using it on the recommendation of a friend.  The color is perfect for my skin tone, it goes on easily and smoothly.  It lasts all day and I really like the coverage.

name: Sheila
review: Covers well..

name: Princess Brianna
review: I have very oily, acne prone skin. This foundation is amazing. I like that the price dropped but it was reasonable before the cut.

name: Jamie
review: I applied with a damp beauty blender and it applied smoothly and looked good in the mirror but up close there was literal chunks of glitter

name: Brannat
review: I was very surprised at this foundation, did not think it would work very well, but is very long lasting and looks so amazing on me, a very natural finish.

name: MeLiSsA
review: I have always used the revlon color stay foundation and LOVED it. So I thought I'd give this a try and I hate it. It doesn't blend and I have great skin not oily and not dry. It's super thick and goes on uneven I hate it!!! Don't waste your money

name: Mo
review: I have been looking for a foundation for quite sometime that matches my skin and has a finish that I actually like.  I was hesitant to buy it because so many people said it was too glittery or watery and I totally disagree.  I absolutely LOVE this foundation.  I never wear a lot of face makeup and this is just right for me.  I will definitely continue to repurchase!!

name: Bells
review: I actually tried this product because I was looking for something that was similar to MakeupForever HD and I read online that it was a great dupe. I tried it for the first time, and I liked how easy it was to blend. It didn't dry on my skin and I was able to apply it easily. (Mind you, I have dry skin w/ no breakouts) I loved the finishing and I thought I would buy again. I went out after being ready and I thought the product was still working. However, I did notice that the foundation seemed to "cracking" up even though I had set it with a translucent powder. Overall, it's great for a few hours but it's not long lasting if you're in to long lasting. It's an ok product, but I wouldn't buy again.

name: Rachelmon
review: I usually use Loreal True Match liquid foundation.I tried this and its really smooth and clean looking.Almost similar to Mac studio fix fluid but this one is thicker.

name: Miskat
review: First time using this airbrush foundation and you only need to apply a little bit to get full coverage.

name: Daniela
review: It was very sheer, and oily

name: Kylie
review: Nothing about this product is an airbrush effect. The coverage is terrible and there are literal chunks of glitter in it that show up on your face. The color is uneven. There are so many other drug store foundations that are so much better like the loreal true match or the matte and poreless

name: NaeNa
review: It didn't last a full work day

name: Joce
review: Meh.

name: cactusqueen
review: why is this so glittery I'm pretty sure there is no foundation in this JUST GLITTER

name: Mp dp
review: I've used expensive brands, but I actually prefer this product.

name: Katy
review: Was looking for flawless medium to full coverage foundation. Have used this in the past and was amazing! Couldn't ever find it again in my color so when I saw it at Ultra, I stocked up! However it's not anywhere near the same as it used to be!

name: Brit
review: This product is a joke. I am not a huge make up fanatic - I don't do any fancy tricks and like a very plain, natural make up look. Even I can tell that this make up is horrible. First, it dries very orange. My face looks a completely different color than my neck. Even when I use a primer, finishing powder, AND setting spray - this foundation clumps together and appears in orange blotches on my face and feels sticky. This is just terrible and I've honestly had better results using N.Y.C. brand which is a very cheap brand. This is also filled with glitter. I was expecting a bit of a shimmer but this is basically a bottle of glitter. My face looks ridiculous after applying this, like I were playing in a child's make up. I can't believe I wasted money on this.

name: TERRY
review: I use it daily and I am satisfy with product

name: Em
review: this product does not lat long at all and when i was applying it my face was super sticky and stayed sticky almost all day long. don't recommend

name: Lisa R
review: I've been using this for years and love it. The coverage is build-able and it makes your skin look beautiful.

name: Paraben Free with SPF Please!
review:
I was excited to try this product because of great reviews, but am sadly disappointed. The pump is not ideal for getting the right amount of product onto hands, and once you do spreading it on your face is a sticky, non-blendable mess. It's like spreading honey onto your face. I switched to this after using another Revlon foundation (Colorstay) for over a decade (because they removed the sunscreen from it and I discovered it contains loads of skin aging parabens) - looking for a smooth, matte and paraben free foundation with spf. This one is a fail - even with powder on top blush/bronzer sticks and goes on blotchy with lines and is impossible to blend, and after a few hours there is a greasy sheen to my whole face. I have never had a problem with shine before - so this was a surprise. Sticks in lines and manages to look cakey while simultaneously being greasy.

Come on Revlon! Either take the parabens out of ColorStay and add the spf back in or find a way to get the smooth, matte long lasting finish of colorstay into this product! Also - I have a medium skin tone and the very lightest shade of this foundation (Ivory) is almost too dark for me. Into the bin with this one.

name: Ashley
review: My skin is pretty blotchy, and this foundation gave me the perfect color I needed to give me an even look all over. Very light And perfect for what I need.

name: Anne70
review: I absolutely love this product. I'm surprised by the reviews that reference sparkle...I don't get that at all. I use a beauty blender sponge and don't know what I would do if they ever discontinued it. I use 04 Nude, with the 02 Light Concealer and the matte finish primer. No shine, no issues with blending.

name: Alifya Marvi
review: This product is a waste of money it has freaking glitter in it!! Too much sparkle :(

name: Bri
review: I hated this foundation. It had very little coverage & there were these weird sparkles in it. The bottle says they're supposed to be some kind of "light catching pigments", but it looks like straight- up glitter. You can actually see the sparkles on your face when you put it on. No. Just no.

name: Belle
review: I have olive skin and I use 005. I've used this the past four years or so and stick with it because of the price and the coverage. Probably could be better quality but it works for me -- probably because I use Tarte Amazonian Powder on top of it.

name: MJ
review: Full coverage, blends well.

name: Amakeup
review: Blends well, hold up well

name: Kellie
review: Everyday wear is perfect. I'm used to the tarte amazon clay but this is good for if you run out and can't wait till payday!! I love it!

name: Yla
review: I like the coverage this product provides but it is oily

name: Hot in PHX
review: This reminded me of the old makeup that Revlon used to have decades ago. Definitely not good for mature skin, sits on top of the skin but enhances the lines, very drying. Had sparkles which didn't enhance skin.

name: Marion
review: I bought this in comparison to the Make Up Forever HD foundation and it covers just as well, I would recommend it for any skin type. I have red skin and eczema!

name: Sarah
review: Didn't like it

name: Lee
review: I have been using this since a year and I just love how it stays in skin

name: Mey
review: I really love this! My go to drug store!

name: Steph
review: Loved how well this blended and gave amazing coverage

name: Sarah
review: Don't like it

name: makayla
review: blends so well and makes my skin look amazing! definitely recommended

name: Unhappy
review: This is a really great alternative to prestige brands. I have really bad acne and oily skin. This product stays on except for on my most oily spots even with primer. So if you're not a huge oil pot, this would work great!

name: Lisa
review: This is the best makeup ever

name: Cee Cee
review: Photographs well

name: Kenzie
review: I like how this product is pretty full coverage but you cannot tell because it is not cakey. It blends well and is one of the best foundations I've ever used (and I've used a lot of high end foundations)

name: n
review: I have had such a hard time matching my complexion. I have fair-medium skin with a red cheeks.  I either look like a ghost or orange.  This is wonderful coverage.

name: Britlyn
review: This product meets all expectations!

name: Lani
review: The  product is great. I have about for bottles of the  foundation. I love it it's easy to apply coming out of a teenager it's good, but the only thing I don't really like about it that the foundation has sparkles I don't not why it does, but u can't really see it. Over  all it's a really great  product for teenagers to use or ones that need to get out the door and this  product would do great.

name: Ale
review: I wouldn't recommend this is didn't know it was so glittery.... I hate it

name: Lady
review: I wore this makeup for a beach wedding and through the sun & entire day it lasted without an retouches

name: Lexi
review: This gives me full coverage all day and night long !

name: Mj
review: Covers my sun damage better than high priced make up. I've tried several.

name: Mj
review: Due to being a sun worshiper. I developed brown spots, the really does well at covering them.

name: rai
review: I love how light it feels, yet it still covers so well. Doesn't look cakey or fake. Very natural. Best I've tried. I will continue to use it.
